item.title: Bootloader Design Pattern
item.description: Extensibility is a lofty goal for software design, and difficult to achieve. The Wikipedia article notes: Extensible design in software engineering is to accept that not everything can be designed in advance. That’s a paradox because it entails that extensible design does not accept that extensibility can be designed in advance! Fortunately, there’s at least one solution that can be intentionally designed and implemented in advance. I call it the “Bootloader” design pattern.
